greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of elements of order 2 in the group SL(2, Z(n)).
comment: Equivalently, the number of cyclic subgroups of the group SL(2, Z(n)) having order 2, counting conjugates as distinct.
formula: If m and n are coprime, a(m*n) = a(m)*a(n)+a(m)+a(n) (i.e. a(n)+1 is multiplicative).
If n > 1 is in A061345, a(n)=1. (End)
example: Case n=2: the three 2 X 2 matrices on Z(2) having determinant 1 and order 2 are:
program: (GAP) Concatenation([0], List([2..10], n->Sum(Filtered( ConjugacyClassesSubgroups( SL(2, Integers mod n)), x->Order( Representative(x))=2 and IsCyclic( Representative(x))), Size)));
(PARI) a(n)={my(id=matid(2)); sum(a=0, n-1, sum(b=0, n-1, sum(c=0, n-1, sum(d=0, n-1, my(M=Mod([a, b; c, d], n)); if(matdet(M)==1, M^2==id))))) - 1}
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 06 2018
